paragraphs: This material may not be published, broadcast, rewritten, or redistributed. ©2025 FOX News Network, LLC. All rights reserved. Quotes displayed in real-time or delayed by at least 15 minutes. Market data provided by Factset. Powered and implemented by FactSet Digital Solutions. Legal Statement. Mutual Fund and ETF data provided by Refinitiv Lipper.
Pope Leo XIV received an invite to throw out the first pitch at the Chicago White Sox's new stadium as long as his schedule will permit it. The pope is a huge White Sox fan.
U.S. Ambassador to the United Nations Mike Waltz labeled the killing of Christians in Nigeria as “genocide wearing the mask of chaos."
Pope Leo XIV calls out massacre in Democratic Republic of Congo, highlighting global persecution of Christians in Nigeria, Sudan and other nations.
Physician, author and Fox News contributor shares personal stories of faith, including the healing of his deaf son Samuel and keeping his 102-year-old father alive.
Bethlehem announces return of Christmas celebrations starting Dec. 6 after two-year pause due to Gaza war. Mayor lights tree in historic Manger Square.
Fox Nation uncovers St. Patrick's legacy as Ireland's influential bishop in the first episode of the second season of "The Saints," helmed by film icon Martin Scorsese.
The Vatican officially rejected the Jesus apparitions reported in Dozulé, France, during the 1970s. The supernatural claims have been declared false after decades.
A new Gallup survey shows a dramatic 17-point drop in American adults valuing religion in their daily lives since 2015, with only 49% saying faith is important.
Pope Leo XIV will welcome top actors and directors for a rare Vatican audience, exploring how creativity can promote human values during a Jubilee Year.
President Donald Trump threatens military action in Nigeria over Christian persecution as President Tinubu defends religious tolerance policies amid escalating violence concerns.
The first Assyrian inscription discovered in Jerusalem reveals ancient biblical-era correspondence between Assyrian Empire and Kingdom of Judah, dating back 2,700 years.
Chicago pastor walks Richmond Slave Trail raising funds for Project H.O.O.D., connecting historical slavery struggles with modern battles against poverty and hopelessness.
A fifth-century Christian mosaic was unearthed in Urfa, Turkey, the traditional birthplace of Abraham, shedding light on early Byzantine art.
A 101-year-old Holocaust survivor who lived through Kristallnacht warns that today's rising antisemitism mirrors Nazi Germany in 1938.
Syria's Christian population has plummeted from 1.5 million to 300,000. Trump's meeting with Syrian leadership could determine their survival in their ancient homeland.
Moody Bible Institute sues Chicago schools over alleged discrimination against Bible college students in teacher training programs due to faith-based hiring practices.
Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, France, expects 12 million visitors this year as it approaches the anniversary of its reopening after the devastating April 2019 fire.
President Donald Trump calls for action against Christian persecution in Nigeria after Boko Haram survivors Joy Bishara and Lydia Pogu share their escape story at the U.N.
Students at NYU, Baruch College, Columbia and Barnard College sat down with Fox News Digital and revealed the truth about how professors promote biased beliefs on campus.
JD Vance opens up about his interfaith marriage, sharing how he and his Hindu-raised wife navigate religious differences through communication and mutual respect.
Trump threatens military action against Nigeria over Christian persecution as Boko Haram survivor Paul Adamu speaks out in support of CPC designation.
Christian persecution in Nigeria has ramped up dramatically as Islamist militants burn villages and kill thousands of believers in targeted attacks across the country.
An Alabama man was arrested for allegedly plotting synagogue attacks across multiple states. The FBI and local authorities prevented potential violence, seizing weapons and ammunition.
Rising antisemitism threatens Jewish communities worldwide as ancient hatred resurfaces in America and the West, demanding urgent action to protect civilization.
Newsom cites biblical teachings to slam federal leaders, Trump admin over government shutdown's impact on food assistance, as California sues USDA over suspended SNAP benefits.

Fox News national correspondent Bryan Llenas reports on Democratic New Jersey gubernatorial candidate Mikie Sherill distancing herself from New York City Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani and Jewish voters' thoughts on ‘Special Report.’
Martin Scorsese's acclaimed series 'The Saints' returns to Fox Nation this November with a second season, featuring Saint Patrick, Saint Peter, and more.
Bill Maher sparked debate comparing little coverage of Nigeria's Christian persecution to Gaza conflict, calling it genocide attempt as jihadist groups kill thousands.
Haunted hotels like the Crescent Hotel and Spa in Arkansas and McMenamins Edgefield in Oregon attract ghost hunters and history enthusiasts nationwide.
Podcaster Joe Rogan praised Jesus Christ as a historically documented figure with the best plan for human interaction and behavior in a recent interview.
